posts.title: Leatherworking Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn how to make long-lasting leather goods
posts.description: Many things now generally made of plastic (shoes, belts, bags, clothing, etc.) used to be made of leather. Today, most leather hides are discarded and completely wasted! But you can still make many useful things from leather. This class will cover selecting leather, project planning, cutting, sewing, molding, decoration, and finishing. Attendees can make a cell phone holster or/and a decorative drink coaster, as time permits. Ages 16+.

posts.title: Hacksburg Open House
posts.subtitle: Tour our Community Workshop
posts.description: Hacksburg is a non-profit Makerspace located in Blacksburg, VA. Started in 2014, we're a community workshop focused on helping creatives and entrepreneurs in the New River Valley complete projects that would otherwise be out of reach. Whether you need equipment, mentorship, or just a place to work, Hacksburg is an accessible, collaborative, and affordable resource where you can build anything from rockets to robots to rocking chairs. Hacksburg members must be 18+, but all ages are welcome at this open house. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of their visit.

posts.title: Hacksburg at Summer Solstice Fest
posts.subtitle: The summer festival for locals
posts.description:
Hacksburg will be exhibiting at the Downtown Blacksburg Summer Solstice Fest. Come out and enjoy hands-on activities, locally made products for sale, food trucks, live music, and more! This event is free and family friendly.
Learn more at downtownblacksburg.com.

posts.title: Modern Kites
posts.subtitle: These aren't just for the beach!
posts.description: Learn how modern kites are designed and constructed using advanced materials. Stunt kites, kiteboarding, and even kite photography will be discussed. This event is open to all ages, but attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class.

posts.title: Modifying CAD
posts.subtitle: Learn to modify existing models for 3D printing
posts.description:
There are an incredible variety of 3D models available online for 3D printers. But what if you need to change something about a model to suit your needs? In this class, you'll learn basic and advanced techniques for modifying 3D models.

This class is intended for ages 16 and up, but younger attendees with 3D printing experience are welcome if you confirm with the board ahead of time (board@hacksburg.org). Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class.

posts.title: Building Radios
posts.subtitle: A hands-on lesson in electromagnetism
posts.description: In this class, attendees will build radios in groups while learning the basics of how sound is transmitted using electromagnetic waves. Digital data transmission (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, etc) will be surveyed with enough information to ignite future learning. Ages 14+.

posts.title: Resin Printing Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's 8K SLA resin printer
posts.description:
Filament-based 3D printers are capable of making an incredible array of parts, but, for high-detail miniatures, our new resin printer is capable of over 10x the resolution. In this class, you'll learn how to use Hacksburg's resin printer, which kind of parts are best-suited to resin printing, and how these machines differ from filament-based printers.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Synthesizer Mini-Class
posts.subtitle: Bebop to the boolean boogie
posts.description: Learn how to make a basic electronic synthesizer by connecting digital and analog electronic components in ways their designers never intended! Attendees will learn the basics of synthesizers and how they are implemented in this informal class after the regular Tuesday meeting.

posts.title: Intro to CNC Machining
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's CNC gantry router
posts.description:
In part one of our series of CNC classes, attendees will learn how to do basic CNC operations and think like a machinist. Details will be given for the operation of Hacksburg's CNC gantry router, generously donated by Onefinity and Torc Robotics, and we will machine a demonstration part.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Seedstarting and Gardening Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn how to grow your own food
posts.description: Get ready for garden season by learning how to start your own plants from seed. Starting from seed saves money and increases the variety of plants you can grow! This class will also cover basic garden prep information such as mixing soil and making planters. The class fee covers a seed-starting kit and seeds. Feel free to bring your own seeds as well!
